title: Simple way to Safely Delay B Push
description: Here's a simple, but effective way to stop the B Push from B Tower or Defender Spawn if you're playing on Site.

title: Retake Setup for A Ramp
description: Clearing out A Ramp can often tip the balance of control over to your team in a retake scenario on A Site.

title: A Site Retake Dizzy from Screens
description: Here's a simple but effective A Site retake Dizzy from Screens that allows you to clear out the area close in front of A Screens.

title: Early Round Mid Support
description: Use this setup to support your team early, and then be ready to delay the enemy team's push through B Main with your Mosh Pit if the info your team gets leads you to that.

title: Simple A Generator Post Plant from A Lobby
description: Here's a simple, but effective post plant for A Site from A Lobby.

title: Safe Early Round Dizzy for Mid from Mid Top
description: Use this to gather information in Mid or open up the opportunity for anyone on your team to peek into Mid.

title: Aggressive Mid Push To Split B Site
description: Here's a simple, but effective Aggressive Mid Push to split B Site.

title: Early Round A Main Dizzy + A Split Dizzy after Cooldown
description: Here's a simple, but effective early round Dizzy to contest space in A Main.

title: Early Round B Main Dizzy
description: Use this Dizzy to take space in B Main at the start of the round.

title: Early Round A Main Push Support
description: Here's a simple, but effective way to push A Main with your team at the very start of the round, and / or contest control of A Main.

title: Delay / Deny B Main Site Execute from Defender Spawn
description: Make sure to coordinate with your team to get the maximum value out of your utility as the enemy players push into Site.

title: Safe Early Round B Main Dizzy
description: Use this Dizzy at the very start of the round look for info in B Main, as well as attempt to flash enemy players in Main to support your Teammates pushing up.

title: A Retake Dizzy + Mosh Pit Lineups
description: Use these simple lineups to hold / retake A Site.

title: B Site Retake / B Split Dizzy To Take B Site
description: Use this Dizzy to take control of B Site.

title: Hold Back B Site with this Mosh Pit + Dizzy Combo
description: Use this simple setup to hold down back B Site with a Mosh Pit and Dizzy.

title: B Site Post Plant Dizzy + Mosh Pit from B Main
description: Catch players off guard with this full utility post plant setup.

title: Early Round B Main Push Into B Site Execute
description: This is a great way to take control of B Main early, and then execute into B Site shortly afterward.

title: Support Dizzy to Disrupt A Site Push
description: Use this Dizzy to safely disrupt the Attacker's push into A Site / break up their push into Site.

title: Early Round A Dish Push with Dizzy + Your Team
description: Use this to take control of A Dish at the very start of the round with 1 or more teammates.

title: Early Round B Main Support Dizzy
description: Use this Dizzy to support your teammate's push into B Main, and then safely pick it up only if you have support from your other teammate or if your teammate has pushed past you to flank the Attackers through Attacker Spawn.

title: Two Mosh Pit Lineups from Same Spot in B Main
description: These two lineup variations cover the two most common plant spots for B Site.

title: Early Round Art Dizzy from A Main that Returns
description: Use this to gather information in Art at the beginning of the round. It will travel back to you and so there is very little risk in using this at least the first time it's used. If enemy players start to expect it though, they may shoot it while it's in the window.

title: B Site Execute Through B Link
description: Use this B Site Execute from B Link.

title: A Split Full Utility Execute Through Art
description: Use this full utility setup to execute an A Split through Art.

title: A Site Execute Dizzy
description: Use this Dizzy when executing into A Site through A Main

title: Break Up / Delay B Main Push from B Link
description: Use this to break up / delay the Attacker's B Main Execute.

title: Simple B Main Delay Mosh Pit
description: Use this simple B Main Delay Mosh Pit to make it difficult for the Attackers to push through the B Main / B Site choke point.

title: B Hall Mosh Pit + Dizzy Retake
description: Use this setup to clear out Hall in B Site.

title: Early A Main Dizzy to Grab Ultimate Orb
description: Use this Dizzy to grab the Ultimate orb in A Main early in the round. If you think the enemy team might be setup for this, ask a teammate to push with you.

title: Simple B Site Execute
description: This setup is usually the most useful when you are low on time, are looking to switch up your team's pacing, or are on an eco. This is because the main objective of this setup is to take B control quickly, and then either play post plant or fight inside of B Site for control.

title: Early Round A Main Dizzy
description: Use this Dizzy early in the round to contest control for A Main right away, and then safely pick it up after throwing it if your team is able to take control of Main.

title: Early Round A Main Control Setup With Team
description: Use this Setup to gain control of A Main early in the round, and make it difficult for the enemy team to push into Main at the start of the round.

title: Break up C Main Push Safely from Waterfall
description: Use this simple and safe Dizzy to catch enemy players as they are pushing through C Main into C Site. Ideally you want players to be fairly close when you use this, so that their push is delayed as much as possible, or your teammates are able to get as much value out of the Dizzy as possible.
